head.supplied: Friday ¶ ¶ The very few men, left me in the Garden, dear Sir Redmond, are required to day to clear up a little for Queens birth day & Sunday. But so far as my ruiniously reduced means will ¶ ¶ admi...

div.p: UM312 Registrar's correspondence, 1873/13 Grounds, University of Melbourne Archives, Melbourne.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 0.3335in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3335in; font-size: 9pt;
font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 0.3335in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3335in; font-size: 9pt;

div.p: The very few men, left me in the Garden, dear Sir Redmond, are required to day to clear up a little for Queens birth day & Sunday. But so far as my ruiniously reduced means will admit of it (we cannot even keep down the weeds) your application for plants again shall have my attention any early morning hour next week. I trust that this time my help after so many years will be for the benefit of my Department publicly acknowledged.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p:
Ferd. von Mueller
MS annotation by Barry, dated 22 (sic) May: 'To the Registrar | Please order Elliott to make his arrangements to call on Dr Mueller on Tuesday next May 27. with a cart at 9 AM'. UM 329, 1873/3 Grounds, letter register says that M says the plants have been received, the date is 73.05.26.
